cohort: DLBCL and FL Patients, Resource Utilization Analysis (2024–2025)
summary: Wide variation in supportive care utilization across lymphoma treatment sites. Site C exceeds benchmarks by 47%, representing $375,000/year in unnecessary resource utilization.

financial_impact.math: $375,000/year = 47% excess × 85 patients × $9,400 avg. supportive care cost

clinical_impact.description: Optimizing resource allocation can maintain or improve clinical outcomes while reducing unnecessary utilization.

metrics.description: Reduced length of stay when hospitalization occurs
Improved quality of life scores with optimized care

peer_comparison.description: Top-performing lymphoma treatment centers maintain 82% resource utilization vs. benchmark while achieving equal or better outcomes, representing $520,000/year in potential savings vs. current practices.

financial_impact.math: $520,000/year = 18% reduction from benchmark × 305 patients × $9,400 avg. cost

action_steps.text: Perform in-depth analysis of Site C utilization patterns
Implement cross-site best practice sharing program
Analyze Site C resource utilization by care category
Implement standardized antiemetic protocols across all sites
Develop G-CSF utilization guidelines based on Site D approach
Create automated alerts for resource-intensive orders

suggestions.text: Consider supportive care pharmacist integration at Site C
